conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to analyze the motion of the projectile in both the horizontal and vertical directions.
Given: Initial velocity \( v_0 = 50 \, 	ext{m/s} \) and Launch angle \( 	heta = 53^\circ \).

premise: The horizontal and vertical components of the initial velocity can be calculated using trigonometric functions.
conclusion: The horizontal component of the initial velocity is \( v_{0x} = v_0 \cos(	heta) = 50 \cos(53^\circ) \).

premise: The horizontal and vertical components of the initial velocity can be calculated using trigonometric functions.
conclusion: The vertical component of the initial velocity is \( v_{0y} = v_0 \sin(	heta) = 50 \sin(53^\circ) \).
The horizontal distance \( L \) is covered with a constant horizontal velocity \( v_{0x} \).

premise: The time \( t \) required to cover the horizontal distance \( L \) is given by: \( L = v_{0x} t \).
conclusion: t =  rac{L}{v_{0x}} =  rac{60 \, 	ext{m}}{30 \, 	ext{m/s}} = 2 \, 	ext{s}
The vertical displacement \( H \) is determined by the vertical component of the motion.

premise: The vertical position \( y \) as a function of time \( t \) is given by: \( y = v_{0y} t -  rac{1}{2} g t^2 \).
conclusion: H = 40 \, 	ext{m/s} 	imes 2 \, 	ext{s} -  rac{1}{2} 	imes 10 \, 	ext{m/s}^2 	imes (2 \, 	ext{s})^2
